title: Make the admin portal clearer and simplify “payment method” management labels

requirements.text: Update admin UI wording to match a simple “Admin Portal” concept: rename user-facing labels from “Receiving Accounts” to “Payment Methods” (or “Payment Accounts”) across admin navigation and pages, while keeping the existing /admin/accounts route unchanged.

quotes: Is it possible to have a simple its admin login Portal to handle  Fee for approve grant and Approve or reject and application Then I also get a space where I am to insert a payment method for them to pay their fees

acceptanceCriteria: In the admin header/navigation, the link currently labeled “Accounts” is relabeled to “Payment Methods” (or “Payment Accounts”) without changing its destination route (/admin/accounts).
The /admin/accounts page title and description are updated to use the same “Payment Methods/Payment Accounts” wording (English).
No public pages (/, /status) expose an “Admin Login” entry point beyond the existing behavior (login button only shown when already authenticated or on an /admin route).

requirements.text: Add an obvious “Payment Methods” entry point inside the Admin Dashboard page so admins can quickly access where they insert/edit payment details for fees.

quotes: Then I also get a space where I am to insert a payment method for them to pay their fees

acceptanceCriteria: Admin Dashboard includes a clearly visible button/link labeled “Payment Methods” (or “Payment Accounts”) that navigates to /admin/accounts.
The button/link is only visible/usable to authenticated admins (i.e., within the existing AdminGuard-protected area).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not edited).
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Adding real payment processing (card payments, Stripe, etc.).
Adding third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is supported.
Changing the existing routes (/admin and /admin/accounts) or altering backend data models for applications, fees, or receiving accounts.
